project.name: MonkeyBars
project.description: Simple structure for handling singular, sequential and parallel units of code.

Task.name: Task
Task.description:
The simplest form of a __MonkeyBars__ task. Once started the task executes all 
functionality located within the `performTask` function block. Set `loggingEnabled`
to see console logs during task execution.

params.name: attributes
params.description: List of attributes to apply to the task

TaskGroup.name: TaskGroup
TaskGroup.description:
A task group, and extention of task, provides the building blocks for creating
a group of tasks that is inherently a task itself.

params.name: attributes
params.description: List of attributes to apply to the task group

ParallelTask.name: ParallelTask
ParallelTask.description:
A ParallelTask is a TaskGroup that runs all of its subtasks ansynchronously. Its
complete functionality is run when all of its sub tasks are complete.

params.name: attributes
params.description: List of attributes to apply to the task group

SequenceTask.name: SequenceTask
SequenceTask.description:
A SequenceTask is a TaskGroup that runs all of its subtasks serially. Its
complete functionality is run when all of its sub tasks are complete.

params.name: attributes
params.description: List of attributes to apply to the task group

classitems.description: Creates task based on the options passed
classitems.name: createTaskWithOptions

classitems.description: Creates an array of tasks based on the options array passed
classitems.name: createSubTasksFromTaskOptionsArray

classitems.description: Creates property descriptors from the passes attributes
classitems.name: createPropertyDescriptorsWithAttributes

classitems.description: Resets the task to its original non executed state
classitems.name: resetTask

classitems.description: Generates a unique id for each task
classitems.name: generateUniqueId

classitems.description: Extention functionality for various task types.
classitems.name: extend

return.description: child Constructor function for extended task type

classitems.description: The kind of task
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: The name of the task if not specified by the instance.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The current state of the task
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Calling this method cancels the task. However it is up to the instance to handle 
the canceled state.
classitems.name: cancel

classitems.description: Calling this method says that the tasks execution is now complete.
classitems.name: complete

classitems.description:
Calling this method to fault a task. If it is part of a group task this will 
also call the groups fault method passing the error up to the group.
classitems.name: fault

params.name: error
params.description: Message associated with the cause of the fault.

classitems.description:
This method is called during the execution lifecycle of the task. It is intentionally
left blank and is up to the instance to describe it functionality.
classitems.name: onChange

params.name: state
params.description: The current state of the task

classitems.description: Convenience method called when the task starts.
classitems.name: onStart

classitems.description: Convenience method called when the task faults.
classitems.name: onFault

classitems.description: Convenience method called when the task completes.
classitems.name: onComplete

classitems.description: Convenience method called when the task is canceled.
classitems.name: onCancel

classitems.description:
This method is required for **simple** tasks and will throw an exception if it 
is called and not overridden. If you overwrite this method on a task group
then you need to make sure that you call the extended/implemented classes
original prototype method (see the example below).
classitems.name: performTask

classitems.description:
Kicks off the execution of the task by calling the tasks `performTask` method. 
This method can only be run once on a task.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: The index of the subtasks that have completed execution.
classitems.name: currentIndex

classitems.description:
Adds a subtask to the groups queue. This is helpful when you want to add
a sub task after instantiation.
classitems.name: addSubTask

params.name: task
params.description:
Either an object containing attributes of a task or
an already instantiated task

classitems.description: description
classitems.name: addSubTaskAfterTask

params.name: task
params.description: Either an object containing attributes of a task or

params.name: afterTask
params.description: Reference to an already added task

classitems.description:
Called when a sub task completes. Must be overridden with functionality 
provided by the extending class.
classitems.name: onSubTaskComplete

classitems.description: Called when a subtask calls its fault method.
classitems.name: onSubTaskFault

classitems.description: Called when a subtask calls its fault method.
classitems.name: onSubTaskCancel

classitems.description:
Processes a sub task and prepares it for execution. This method overwrites the
tasks on change functionality. If you wish to have a sub task that handles 
its own change functionality then you will need to implement the partner 
convenience methods.
classitems.name: processSubTask

classitems.description:
Removes a task from its group. Removing the task after it has executed will
have no apparent affect as it has already ran.
classitems.name: removeSubTask

params.name: task
params.description: The task you wish to remove from the group.

classitems.description: Return a Task object, if it exists, based on the `tid` passed.
classitems.name: getTaskById

params.name: tid
params.description: The id of the task you want

classitems.description: The kind of task
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Name of the task
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Checks whether or not the group has any enabled sub tasks.
classitems.name: hasNoEnabledSubTasks

classitems.description: Processes all of the sub tasks available for the group
classitems.name: processSubTasks

classitems.description:
This method is overridden from `TaskGroups` implementation because of the 
nature of a parallel task. When a task is added it should be immediately
processed and started.
classitems.name: addSubTask

params.name: task
params.description: Either an object containing attributes of a task or

classitems.description:
Overridden from TaskGroup. This method is run everytime a sub task
completes. When all subtasks are complete the groups complete method
is called.
classitems.name: onSubTaskComplete

classitems.description:
Overridden from Task. First checks to see if there are any enabled
subtasks to process. If there arent the groups complete method is called.
If there are then the group processes all of the sub tasks it has.
classitems.name: performTask

classitems.description: The kind of task
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: The name of task
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Starts the next task in the queue after its previous sibling has completed.
classitems.name: startNextSubTask

classitems.description:
Overridden from TaskGroup. As long as the group has not been canceled,
when a sub task completes it starts the next sibling in the queue.
classitems.name: onSubTaskComplete

classitems.description:
Overriden from TaskGroup. As long as the group has not been canceled,
when a sub task is canceled it simply moves on to the next task in the queue.
classitems.name: onSubTaskCancel

classitems.description:
Starts the next sub task in the sequence. If overriden you need to call the 
SequenceTask's prototype `performTask` method.
classitems.name: performTask

classitems.description:
Decorator to provide for loop functionality for the task. The task executes
as many times as referenced by the count attribute provided by the instance.
classitems.name: ForTaskDecorator

classitems.description:
Decorator to provide while loop functionaliy. The task executed until the `while`
method returns false.
classitems.name: WhileTaskDecorator

classitems.description: The task doesnt execute until the when method provided returns true.
classitems.name: WhenTaskDecorator

classitems.name: TaskStates

classitems.description: description needed

classitems.description: description needed
classitems.name: TaskDecorators
